unnormalised: The govt. is cracking down on fake degree rackets, y'all! Apparently, a lot of folks are using bogus edu credentials to land jobs. They’re making fake mark sheets and degree certificates. Some are even using others' registration numbers, like someone else's UGC NET registration number or a random Roll No. from a University exam.
normalised: The government is cracking down on fake degree rackets, you all! Apparently, a lot of folks are using bogus education credentials to land jobs. They are making fake mark sheets and degree certificates. Some are even using others' registration numbers, like someone else's U-G-C N-E-T registration number or a random Roll Number from a University exam.

unnormalised: News just in: the Ministry of Education is planning to introduce a national digital repository. All degrees and certificates will be uploaded there. This'll allow employers to verify the authenticity online – kinda like a digital ID, but for your education! This will make it so much harder to use a fake certificate, or a fake Employee ID made using someone else's PAN card.

This will make it so much harder to use a fake certificate, or a fake Employee I-D made using someone else's P-A-N card.

unnormalised: According to sources, they're also looking into using Aadhaar verification for employment. Employers could use your Aadhaar No. as a unique identifier to track your job history and qualifications. This should weed out folks with dodgy backgrounds and give honest candidates a fair chance. What are your thoughts on all this, folks?
